content:
Diagnosis:	Intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma

Management:		15 Jan 2024 Right hepatectomy

Histology:	Moderately differentiated cholangiocarcinoma, T3N0M0, R0 resection, PDL1 CPS 40

Current Situation:	Post-operative follow-up

I reviewed [redacted name] today following completion of adjuvant capecitabine. She has tolerated the treatment well with only grade 1 palmar-plantar syndrome which has now resolved. Her liver function tests have normalized and recent CT imaging on 15/4/24 shows no evidence of disease recurrence. Performance status remains 0 and she has returned to work full-time. Clinical examination today was unremarkable with well-healed surgical scars.

The plan is to continue with 3-monthly surveillance imaging for the first year. I have arranged a CT chest/abdomen/pelvis for July 2024 and will review her with the results. Blood tests including LFTs and CA19-9 will be monitored monthly via the GP.

cancer_timeline.value: CT imaging shows no evidence of disease recurrence

status_updates.value: Post-operative cholangiocarcinoma patient completed adjuvant capecitabine with good tolerance. No evidence of recurrence on latest imaging.
Review with CT results in July 2024, monthly LFTs and CA19-9 via GP
